thread.title: Everton chief Ronald Koeman ready to gatecrash top four after Toffees make it nine unbeaten
thread.title_full: Everton chief Ronald Koeman ready to gatecrash top four after Toffees make it nine unbeaten

author: David Maddock
title: Everton chief Ronald Koeman ready to gatecrash top four after Toffees make it nine unbeaten
text:
Sport Everton chief Ronald Koeman ready to gatecrash top four after Toffees make it nine unbeaten The Toffees have taken 21 points from the last 27 on offer and are making a late play for Europe - and the six sides above them Share Koeman's side are flying at present (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football     
Ronald Koeman has targeted a Champions League charge as his revolution at Goodison gathers pace. 
The Everton boss watched his side make it nine Premier League games unbeaten with a 2-0 win over Sunderland. 
They have now taken 21 points from a possible 27 and has not ruled out making a late run for Champions League qualification as his side’s momentum continues to grow. 
The win over bottom side Sunderland extended their unbeaten Premier League run to nine matches, during which they have taken 21 points. 
And although they are still in seventh, Arsenal, in fourth, are only six points ahead and Koeman has urged his players to set themselves the target of catching them. Romelu Lukaku is in fine form (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More 
“The worst situation for a football player is you play for nothing,” said the Dutchman. 
“Yeah, we want the highest position but I like to play for something. 
“Above us is still a gap but it is never ending, when it is five or six points it is still possible to reach them. 
“But the first team behind us is West Brom (four points back) and we get West Brom at home in two weeks.” Read More
